definition: to dismiss from office/to discharge/to sack
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: He felt browned off when he heard that he waw dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 當他聽到自己被解職時感到很不痛快。

sentences.english: The cowardly officer was disgraced for failing to do His duty.
sentences.chinese: 這卑怯的官員因不盡職被解職。

sentences.english: Shanghai Communist Party Chief Chen Liangyu was removed from office and is under investigation.
sentences.chinese: 原上海市委書記陳良宇被解職，目前正在接受調查。

sentences.english: He became a hermit after he was dismissed from office.
But the Brazilian Football Federation (CBF) said that Dunga and his technical staff had been dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 巴西足協宣佈鄧加和其技術小組人員都已被解職。

sentences.english: In the end, both were relieved.
sentences.chinese: 最後終於以杜孫二人雙雙解職了事。

sentences.english: Mottaki, Iran has not disclosed the specific reasons for being fired.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗方面一直未披露穆塔基遭解職的具體原因。

sentences.english: And the news of being dismissed dismayed him.
sentences.chinese: 並且被解職的消息使他驚愕。

definition: (of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
to release for medical treatment (of a prisoner)
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
